ExplntnTxt: The College uses Academic Works software, an excel spreadsheet, and a series of contracts within its billing system to track and maintain activity for recipients of tuition assistance.

THE COLLEGE COMPLIES WITH THE U.S. DEP. OF EDUCATION POLICY REGARDING TITLE IV FUNDS AND OTHER GRANT AWARDS. THE COLLEGE HAS DEDICATED INDIVIDUALS PERFORM THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF THE GRANT. THESE INDIVIDUALS ARE CLASSIFIED AS FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS AND GRANT ADMINISTRATORS WHO WORK IN CONJUNCTION WITH FINANCE PROFESSIONALS TO ENSURE PROPER STEWARDSHIP OF FUNDS. THESE INDIVIDUALS FOLLOW THE STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE GRANT. FUNDS ARE DRAWN AFTER EXPENSES ARE INCURRED. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED.
THE UNIVERSITY COMPLIES WITH ALL CONTRACTUAL AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS WHEN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS.

WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID A STUDENT WILL RECEIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FIRST CALCULATES HOW MUCH THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD. THIS CALCULATION RELIES ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION: 1) A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA); AND 2) A FINANCIAL AID PROFILE; BOTH OF WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY THE FAMILY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE THAT FILLS THE GAP BETWEEN THE CALCULATED AMOUNT THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD AND THE COST OF ATTENDING MACALESTER COLLEGE. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE COLLEGE'S HIGH WINDS FUND AWARDS SMALL GRANTS TO NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO MAKE OUR NEIGHBORHOOD A VIBRANT PLACE TO LIVE, AND TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS COMMITTED TO AREA LIVABILITY ISSUES. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT DESCRIBING USE OF GRANT FUNDS AT LEAST ANNUALLY OR AT THE CLOSE OF A SPECIFIC PROJECT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE TUITION ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO THE STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF A CREDIT TO THEIR ACCOUNT. THE TUITION ASSISTANCE IS NOT PERMITTED TO EXCEED THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILL.
The University's financial aid department monitors and maintains records regarding all financial aid awards.

SCHOLARSHIPS & FINANCIAL AID ARE AVAILABLE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. A FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE MADE UP OF THE FACULTY AND THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH GRANTS AND CONTRACTS REQUIREMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDIT, AS WELL AS SEFA, WHICH TESTS THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE FOR FEDERAL GRANT COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS.
ALL GRANTS RECEIVED BY GEORGIA REGENTS RESEARCH INSTITUTE, INC. ARE SUBCONTRACTED TO GEORGIA REGENTS UNIVERSITY.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED GENERAL SUPPORT GRANTS TO BE USED FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. THE GRANT AWARD LETTERS PROHIBIT THE GRANTEE FROM USING THE GRANT FUNDS FOR LOBBYING AND POLITICAL PURPOSES, AND REQUIRE THE GRANTEE TO FURNISH A REPORT TO THE ORGANIZATION DESCRIBING THE CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES FULFILLED BY THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS.

STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FAFSA. ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES, BY THEIR ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS ARE APPROPRIATELY AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE AWARDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT FUNDS ARE RECONCILED EACH SEMESTER AND REPORTED TO THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES OR AGENCIES. FUNDS ARE ALSO AUDITED ANNUALLY.
THE UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON DOE TITLE IV REGULATIONS AND UNIVERSITY APPROVED POLICIES.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.
SCHOLARSHIPS TO MATRICULATE IN THE COLLEGE.

ALL GRANT ACTIVITY IS REQUIRED TO MEET THE SPECIFIC STANDARDS AND STIPULATIONS OF THE GRANTOR AND OPERATE WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AND FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN ON A MONTHLY BASIS. INTERNAL REPORTS AND AWARD LEVELS ARE REVIEWED PRIOR TO EACH DRAW TO DETERMINE IF CASH SHOULD BE DRAWN FOR INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. FINALLY, THE COLLEGE UNDERGOES AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FEDERAL AWARDS UNDER THE GUIDELINES OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH FROM LEGISLATION THAT CREATED THE MERC TRUST FUND (PMAP/PGAMC DISTRIBUTION) THAT PROVIDES REMUNERATION FOR THOSE FACILITIES THAT SERVED AS CLINICAL TRAINING SITES FOR THE COLLEGE'S NURSE PRACTITIONER AND CLINICAL NURSE SPECIALIST STUDENTS DURING THE 2011-2012 ACADEMIC YEAR. THE AMOUNTS PAID FROM THE FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE MERC LEGISLATION TO EACH ORGANIZATION LISTED IN PART II IS BASED ON THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS THEY HAD AND THE LENGTH OF TIME THEY SPENT AT EACH RESPECTIVE FACILITY. TRAINING SITES MUST ALSO HAVE A CURRENT ACTIVE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE ENROLLMENT STATUS IN MINNESOTA.
The funds are given to the school for use in running the school.

FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S FAMILY. FINANCIAL INFORMATION AND SUGGESTED FINANCIAL NEED OF THE RECIPIENT'S PARENT(S) OR GUARDIAN(S) IS PROVIDED TO THE SCHOOL BY AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE NOT FROM GRANTS, BUT ARE TRACKED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF BIG BEND COMMUNITY COLLEGE, BILLED TO THE FOUNDATION FROM BIG BEND COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THEN PAID TO BIG BEND COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THE FUNDS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS COME FROM DONORS AND FUNDRAISERS.

STUDENTS FILL OUT A FAFSA TO SEE WHAT GOVERNMENT AID THEY QUALIFY FOR. THE DIRECTOR FOR FINANCIAL AID AWARDS THE GOVERNMENT AID BASED ON TITLE IV RULES AND REGULATIONS AND AID FROM THE COLLEGE BASED ON COLLEGE POLICY. RECORDS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN STUDENT FILES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS AUDITED ANNUALLY.

THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT AUDITABLE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN SUPPORT OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT CHARGES TO GRANTS, CONTRACTS, OR AGREEMENTS. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR INITIALLY APPROVES ALL EXPENDITURES OF A SPONSORED PROJECT AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING WHETHER THE SPONSOR WILL ALLOW AN ITEM OF DIRECT COST, BEFORE THE EXPENDITURE IS PROCESSED. IN ADDITION, THESE EXPENDITURES ARE ALSO CLOSELY REVIEWED AND MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS BEFORE THE EXPENDITURE REQUISITION IS APPROVED FOR PAYMENT TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY UTILIZED FOR THE PURPOSES SPECIFIED IN THE GRANT CONTRACT/AGREEMENT.
ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERIMINED BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE DONOR OR INSTITUTION.

DISBURSEMENTS FOR GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT. PERIODIC REPORTS ON THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE RECEIVED FROM THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE EXPENDED ACCORDING TO THE STATED PURPOSE.
ALL GRANTS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS DIRECTLY, ACCORDING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS.

ALL STUDENT AID AWARD LETTERS ARE PREPARED BY LINDENWOOD COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. EACH AWARD LETTER HAS A STATEMENT OF CONDITIONS AND IS SIGNED BY THE STUDENT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS ALL AID TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR ACADEMIC USAGE. BOTH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITOR THESE FUNDS.

Students receiving scholarships are judged worthy thereof through the institution's assessment based on academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Use of funds is monitored according to standards as published in the student handbook which include satisfactory academic progress standards.

Emergency/Living Exp.: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Insurance/Travel: Aid is paid on behalf of the student directly to the insurance company/airline.Honor Awards: Honor awards are awarded for exceptional scholarship achievement to graduating students. No limitations are placed on the use of this money.Missions: Mission trip aid is awarded to students going on summer mission trips. If the student does not go on the trip, he/she gives the money back.Tuition/books: Tuition is discounted to apply aid.
- A committee is assigned to consider student applicants and assign scholarships on a non-discriminatory basis.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A LISTING OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED ACCORDING TO ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, CHRISTIAN INVOLVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR TALENT. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS WHICH ARE RECONCILED INTERNALLY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Org.'s Proc. for Mon. the Use of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Although Indiana University Health Arnett, Inc. does not monitor the use of grant funds once distributed, through due diligence the organization has reasonably confirmed that the entities to which the contributions are made are highly reputable in the community and use the funds for the purposes intended.

AWARDS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS ARE NOT MONITORED BECAUSE THEY ARE AWARDED BASED ON MEETING THE SELECTION CRITERIA. TUITION ASSISTANCE IS NOT MONITORED BECAUSE PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. RESEARCH GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE CONTRIBUTORS WHO CONTRIBUTE MONEY BASED ON REACHING PREDEFINED MILESTONES AND REQUIRE PERIODIC REPORTING.
ALL REQUESTS FOR GRANTS OR OTHER GSAR SUPPORT ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED
BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EXPENDITURES ARE SUBJECT TO MONITORING BY
THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. A FINAL REPORT, INCLUDING A FINAL ACCOUNTING
OF EXPENDITURES ARE REQUIRED WHERE APPROPRIATE.

Tuition discounts are available to eligible persons participating in the IMPACT 360 program. The requests for financial aid or discount are submitted to the Board of Directors for approval as a part of the annual strategic ministry plan.
NA
THE COLLEGE HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THEY ALSO COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENT FOR AWARDING STUDENT AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE AMOUNTS, ELIGIBILITY, AND SELECTION CRITERIA USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE ASSISTANCE BY REVIEWING GRADE TRANSCRIPTS AND ATTENDANCE RECORDS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.
HALLMARK MAKES GRANTS TO WORTHY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE THE SAME BELIEFS AS THE UNIVERSITY.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. THEY ALSO COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR AWARDING STUDENT AID.
THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS SELECTS AND APPROVES GRANTEES AND MAINTAINS THE RECORDS TO SUBTANTIATE THE GRANTS.

Financial assistance programs at the University are funded through a variety of sources. It is intended that the various financial assistance programs be used to recognize academic, athletic, servant leadership, and special achievement; meet financial needs; or provide self-help opportunities through student work-study programs and parent/student loans. While it is not possible to guarantee that funding will be available for every needy applicant, the financial assistance programs at the University are designed to help cover the difference between the direct cost of attending the University and the student's own resources. Each application is reviewed based upon an individual assessment in order to determine the type of resources that will best serve the student.

FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, BOOKS AND OTHER SCHOOL RELATED SUPPLIES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE BURSAR TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE PROPER ACCOUNT AND PROPERLY UTILIZED TO STAY IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT'S RESTRICTIONS.

THE AWARDS ARE DETERMINED AND CANDIDATES SELECTED BY THE K-STATE GRADUATE SCHOOL. THE GRADUATE SCHOOL REQUESTS THE FUNDS FROM KSURF AS NEAR AS POSSIBLE TO THE BEGINNING OF APPLICABLE SCHOOL TERM AND THE FUNDS ARE DEPOSITED INTO A RESTRICTED FEES ACCOUNT. THE FUNDS USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TRACKED IN A SEPARATE GL ACCOUNT FOR THE RESERVE AND THIS IS WHERE THE DETAIL OF USE OF THE FUNDS IS TRACKED.
All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Ongoing correspondence with grantee.
Scholarships to eligible students who meet the criteria of the College and/or trust instruments which established the scholarship fund.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY MONITORING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF COURSES AND PROGRAMS TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.
Financial aid was adopted

HESSTON COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR MERIT AS DETERMINED BY SEMINARY ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL
GRANTS ARE ISSUED TO COVER THE EDUCATION COST OF THE WCMS PROGRAM.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND MERIT. FUNDS ARE APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, AND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS).

GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY AWARDED TO THOSE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR A PARTICULAR GRANT OR GRANTS. ALSO, THEY MUST MEET OUR SATISFACTORY PROGRESS POLICY TO CONTINUE RECEIVING THESE FUNDS, WHETHER IT IS FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OR FAULKNER UNIVERSITY FUNDS.
STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION SHOWING FINANCIAL NEED. THE STYDENTS MUST USE THE SCHOLARSHIP AT THE CINCINNATI COLLEGE OF MORTUARY SCIENCE AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED BY INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES WITH RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THE INSTRUCTION GUIDELINES ARE PROPERLY FOLLOWED.

THE DEAN'S OFFICE MONITORS THE GRADES FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS. STUDENTS WITH CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGES BELOW THE REQUIREMENT FOR THEIR DEGREE PROGRAM RISK LOSING THEIR GRANTS. ALSO, THE DEAN'S OFFICE MONITORS THE NUMBER OF CLASSES TAKEN BY ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS. GRANTS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE FOR THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF COURSES FOR THE STUDENT'S DEGREE PROGRAM. NO GRANT IS AVAILABLE FOR ANY STUDENT THAT EXCEEDS THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF COURSES. AN AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE SEMINARY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE PURSUING A DEGREE OFFERED BY ALLEN COLLEGE AND MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF PARTICULAR SCHOLARSHIPS. A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM ALLEN COLLEGE AND THE MEMORIAL FOUNDATION OF ALLEN HOSPITAL REVIEW APPLICATIONS AND SELECT INDIVIDUALS WHO QUALIFY.

COE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS FROM NSF, DEPT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER AGENCIES OR BRANCHES OF THE US GOVERNMENT. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ARE USED FOR EACH GRANT TO MONITOR RECEIPTS AND DISBURSEMENTS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING AND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL REQUIRED FINANCIAL REPORTING TO THE GRANT PROVIDER ARE COMPLETED TIMELY AND AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM ARE DONE WHEN REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY FILES AN A-133.

GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE MASTER OF DIVINITY PROGRAM AND ARE CHOSEN BASED ON NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS COMPLETED IN THE DEGREE PROGRAM, NUMBER OF CREDIT HOURS TAKEN EACH TERM, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC MERIT. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS POLICY INSTITUTED BY THE INSTITUTION. BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS EACH SEMESTER TO VERIFY THAT THEY INDEED ARE CORRECT ON THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT AND IN THE G/L SYSTEM.
The College has policies and procedures in place that are followed in order to award students institutional aid.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING THE AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. THESE RECIPIENTS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY ASSESSING THEIR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.
THE COLLEGE MONITORS ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS BY ASSESSING STUDENT RECORDS, FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AWARDS.
Scholarships are awarded on a merit and need base up on the amount charged on a reportable system.

LINE 2 Any scholarships/grants to students are determined by the financial aid office in which each student file is reviewed in accordance with designated eligibility requirements of the scholarships or grants. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE THEN MONITORED BY DISBURSING FUNDS FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STYDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATE STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AT THE CONCLUSION OF EVERY ACADEMIC YEAR.
ALL GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH EACH GRANT. THEY ARE ALSO MONITORED BY MEMBERS OF SENIOR STAFF.

MOST GRANTS AND SCHOLARHSIPS ADMINISTERED BY BELLIN COLLEGE ARE AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED; SOME HAVE ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SET BY DONORS OR OTHER ENTITIES. THE BURSAR AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID RECONCILE AWARDS/PAYMENTS ON A REGULAR BASIS TO ENSURE ACCURACY ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

CARROLL COLLEGE AND FEDERAL NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FEDERAL FAFSA AND NEEDS ANALYSIS. NEW STUDENT MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA AND TEST SCORES OR TRANSFER GPA FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. STATE GRANT REPORTING IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR AFTER THE ACADEMIC YEAR IS COMPLETED. FEDERAL FISAP REPORTING IS COMPLETED PRIOR TO OCTOBER OF EACH YEAR FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR.

Most University of Saint Francis students receive financial aid. The Office of Financial Aid at the University of Saint Francis administers financial aid from federal, state, institutional, and private resources according to the Federal guidelines provided by the U.S. Department of Education. The University of Saint Francis bases financial aid awards on the information submitted by the student and family via the FASFA as well as the student's academic records.
ALL GRANTS ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AT THE COLLEGE.

Scholarships are awarded to students based upon criteria such as need, area of study, grade point average, among others, as established by scholarship documents and donor restrictions. Scholarships are applied to the students' accounts to help cover the costs of tuition, room, and board.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID SERVICES AWARDS FINANCIAL AID IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT. FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDING GUIDELINES ARE USED IN AWARDING STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID. STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS ARE REVIEWED ON A BI-WEEKLY BASIS TO ENSURE THAT ALL STUDENTS ARE CURRENTLY ENROLLED ACCORDING TO APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES. A QUALITY CONTROL CHECK IS IN PLACE IN THAT A FILE AUDIT IS PERFORMED OF A RANDOM SAMPLE OF FILES TO ENSURE THAT PROPER PROCEDURES ARE BEING FOLLOWED. AN ANNUAL AUDIT IS PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE COMPANY TO ENSURE THAT THERE ARE NO GROSS VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS.
FINANCIAL AID IS GIVEN TO STUDENTS AT PHILLIPS THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY. GRANTS ARE MADE WITHIN DONOR RESTRICTIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are granted to deserving students based on the terms of the grant establishing the particular scholarship fund. For example, some scholarships are available only to students in the Missions Department, or Music majors, etc., while some scholarships funds can be given to any student who can show a need.Scholarships and grants are placed on student receivable accounts except in a few exceptional cases. If there is a credit balance left on the student account no amounts are refunded until any unused scholarships or grants are reversed.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.

THE ORGANIZATION OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS TO GRADUATING STUDENTS WHO ARE CONTINUING THEIR EDUCATION. THE GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO THE RECIPIENTS AND THEY ARE TO USE THE FUNDS WITHIN FIVE YEARS FOR THEIR EDUCATION.

DRAKE UNIVERSITY HAS EMPLOYEES DEDICATED TO POST-AWARD REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, DRAKE RECEIVES AN A-133 AUDIT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FROM OUR EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. OUR FY13 A-133 AUDIT EXPRESSED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION WITH NO FINDINGS, NO SIGNIFICANT DEFICIENCIES IN INTERNAL CONTROL, AND NO INSTANCES OF MATERIAL NONCOMPLIANCE.
THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS AND APPLIES CRITERIA BASED ON CIRCUMSTANCE, GRADE-POINT AVERAGE AND NEED. THE PROCESS IS APPLIED CONSISTENTLY TO ALL STUDENTS OF THE INSTITUTION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Use of grant funds are monitored by the Business Office, Financil Aid Department and Grant Coordinator, if applicable, to determine that required criteria are met.

PROCEDURES FOR APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID: WHENEVER POSSIBLE, CATAWBA COLLEGE WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF A STUDENT THROUGH MERIT PERFORMANCE-BASED AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. A POTENTIAL STUDENT APPLIES AND IS ACCEPTED TO CATAWBA COLLEGE. AT THE TIME OF THEIR ACCEPTANCE, MERIT AID IS DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS COUNSELOR ACCEPTING THE APPLICATION BASED ON A MATRIX CHART THAT HAS BEEN SET UP WITH REGARD TO GPA AND SAT SCORES, LIVING ON OR OFF CAMPUS, AND A SEPARATE TRANSFER STUDENT MATRIX. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AND, THUS, MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. WITH REGARDS TO ATHLETICS AT CATAWBA COLLEGE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL ATHLETES TO MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT GO OVER CONFERENCE REGULATIONS REGARDING BOOKS AND SUPPLIES. CATAWBA COLLEGE REFERS TO THE NCAA DIVISION II MANUAL FOR POLICIES REGARDING STUDENT ATHLETES. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR SIGNS OFF ON THE SQUAD LISTS AND CHECKS FOR ELIGIBILITY WITH THE COMPLIANCE DIRECTOR AND, THE ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENTERING THE ATHLETIC INFORMATION INTO THE CAI SYSTEM. THE CAI SYSTEM IS ALSO USED TO DETERMINE EQUIVALENCY COMPUTATIONS.

MONIES GIVEN TO THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE FOR THE SUPPORT OF ANOTHER ORGANIZATION THAT THE COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION BELIEVES IS WORTHY OF THEIR SUPPORT. THE USE OF THE FUNDS IS MONITORED IN THAT THE COLLEGE KNOWS THAT THE SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE ON THE COLLEGE'S CAMPUS MINISTERING TO STUDENTS. REGARDING SCHOLARSHIPS, THESE ARE VERY SELDOM PAID IN CASH. THE SCHOLARSHIPS (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW SMALL HONORS DAY AWARDS) ARE PLACED DIRECTLY ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS NEVER EXCEED THE TOTAL COSTS CHARGED.

Grants to individuals: The University provides financial assistance to students that submit a written application and meet the University's criteria for financial assistance. Applications are reviewed by the Financial Aid Department and/or scholarship committees, depending upon the particular terms of each scholarship. Awards are applied against the student's tuition due to the University. The University monitors each student to assure that he/she remains enrolled in school and continues to satisfy the criteria for his/her specific scholarship. If the student withdraws from the University, then any remaining funds are returned to the scholarship pool to be awarded to another student.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENT TO COVER CHARGES OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND OTHER FEES RELATED TO THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

The Newseum Institute offers several scholarships and grants during the year. Monitoring of these funds is not required as the grants are only made to those individuals who participate in the Institute's classes.

THE COLLEGE HAS A NUMBER OF FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS. WITH THE ISSUANCE OF EACH AWARD A TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED ACCOUNT IS CREATED IN THE DATABASE. AWARD LETTERS ARE KEPT IN A SEPARATE FILE WITH THE PRIMARY CONTACT INFORMATION. IF THE GRANTEE DOES NOT HAVE ELIGIBILITY THE GRANT IS NOT AWARDED. IF THE ELIGIBILITY OF THE GRANTEE HAS CHANGED THE INSTITUTION RETURNS THE AWARDED FUNDS. THE GRANTS ARE BASED ON FAMILY INCOME CONTRIBUTIONS, AND/OR ACADEMIC STANDING, AND/OR ATHLETIC ABILITY, AND/OR INDIVIDUAL TALENT.
Students seeking financial assistance must file a FAFSA to determine their eligibility and need for grant and scholarship aid.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT WORKS WITH DONORS TO ESTABLISH GUIDELINES FOR THE USE AND DISBURSEMENT OF ANY DONATED FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE DONOR'S WISHES AND WITHIN PRACTICAL AND LEGAL PROCESSES. THE DONOR'S RESTRICTIONS ("WISHES") ARE PUT IN WRITING WITH COPIES MAINTAINED IN THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, IF APPLICABLE. IF THE DONATION IS FOR GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO BE DISTRIBTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS A SPREASHEET OF GRANT TITLES AND RESTRICTIONS WHICH ARE UPDATED AS NEEDED AS WELL AS A PERMANENT PAPER FILE. THE GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE "MATCHED" WITH AN ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT BY THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE WILL RECEIVE A LIST OF THESE RECIPIENTS IN THE FALL AND AN UPDATED LIST IN THE EARLY SPRING. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE REVIEWS THE LIST AND PREPARES LUNCHEON INVITATIONS FOR MOST OF THE RECIPIENTS AND DONORS. THE FINAL STEP IN THE PROCESS IS A RANDOM AUDIT CONDUCTED ONCE A YEAR BY AN OUTSIDE AUDIT FIRM.

NEED-BASED GRANTS WERE AWARDED TO WARREN WILSON COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR STUDENT AID) RESULTS. FAFSA RESULTS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, BUT MANY OF THESE DOLLARS WERE USED TO MEET THE FEDERAL DEFINITION OF 'NEED'.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MANUAL AND OR ELECTRONIC VERIFICATION OF ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THE SYSTEM DISBURSEMENT OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT OCCURS ONLY AFTER GLOBAL AND ITEM TYPE SPECIFIC DISBURSEMENT ELIGIBILITY RULES ARE MET. UPON DISBURSEMENT, PAYMENT ALLOCATION RULES IN THE SYSTEM ALLOCATE THE SCHOLARSHIPS TO APPROPRIATE PREDEFINED CHARGES. AFTER DISBURSEMENT AUDITS ARE DONE AT VARIOUS TIME INTERVALS TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED BY THE BOARD, AUTHORIZED BY THE DEAN. AND AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. THESE FUNDS ARE DEDUCTED FROM STUDENT TUIION. THE INSTITUTE MONITORS STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO DETERMINE ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT OR FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS APPLY FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIP - THEY ARE AWARDED BY A COMMITTEE. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DURING THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT. FRESHMEN ENROLLMENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TO INCOMING FRESHMEN BASED UPON THEIR INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, SAT SCORES AND FINANCIAL NEEDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE; THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

All Scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depends on other factors such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required OMB Circular A-133 audit annually.

THE MAJORITY OF INSTITUTIONAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS IS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, FOR WHICH THE UNIVERSITY HAS A PREDETERMINED GRID THAT PROVIDES THE AMOUNTS TO BE AWARDED BASED ON THE STUDENTS ACTUAL GPA AND TEST SCORES AND AS NEEDED, EVALUATION BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. OTHER INSTITUTIONAL AID CONSISTS OF RETURN MISSIONARY, TALENT AND OTHER NEED-BASED GRANTS. RETURNED MISSIONARY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,000 PER YEAR TO ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED A MISSION FOR THE CHURCH OF JESUS CHRIST OF LATTER-DAY SAINTS. TALENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN VARIOUS AMOUNTS, NOT TO EXCEED $2,000 PER STUDENT, AND ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE NOMINATION OF THE UNIVERSITY COACHES, THEATRE/MUSIC DIRECTOR, ETC. AND APPROVAL OF THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE. UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND VARIOUS OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED AS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. FEDERAL & STATE GRANTS, INCLUDING PELL, SEOG, SMART, AND VTAG ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND MEET THE VARIOUS QUALIFICATIONS. FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS ARE VERIFIED INTERNALLY BY OUR FINANCIAL AID STAFF. THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION (DOE) SELECTS A MUNIMUM 30% OF ALL STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE A FAFSA TO VERIFY. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES THE APPROPRIATE VERIFICATION DOCUMENTATION TO THE DOE AND MAINTAINS A COPY OF THESE DOCUMENTS ON FILE.

IT IS THE POLICY OF GRACE BIBLE COLLEGE TO PROCESS ALL INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AWARDS THROUGH THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHICH CONSISTS OF THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, VICE PRESIDENT FOR BUSINESS AND FINANCE, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR COMMUNITY LIFE AND STUDENT SERVICE. THE COMMITTEE MAY ALSO CHOOSE TO OCCASIONALLY INCLUDE OTHER PERTINENT FACULTY OR STAFF.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS ARE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND ARE APPLIED TOWARD THE COST OF TUITION ONLY.

The Financial Aid office maintains a database of all students, their eligibility for grant funds determined through FASFA and other analytic procedures, the amount awarded and accepted by each student and documentation of verifying data. The College also has an A-133 audit performed each year in addition to the financial statement audit.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The Organization requires students who receive assistance to complete applications for assistance and demonstrate their need. Once assistance is received by a student the Organization monitors the student to ensure that the courses for which assistance was received are successfully completed.
THE FOUNDATION GRANTS AMOUNTS DIRECTLY TO THE VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITY (UNIVERSITY). ALL FUNDS ARE USED DIRECTLY IN COMPLETING THE EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS).

THE MAJORITY OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE AWARDED ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES OUTLINED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE. TYPICALLY, GRANT MONEY IS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE AND IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE FEDERAL WORK-STUDY PROGRAM DOES ALLOW FUNDS TO BE DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENT STUDENT. GIFTS TO ORGANIZATIONS WERE CHARITABLE IN NATURE AND DID NOT REQUIRE FORMAL MONITORING OF THE USE OF FUNDS.

All grants are awarded only after confirming a student's eligibility -consistent to all grant criteria. Each scholarship and grant is reconciled at the end of each semester and award year to verify students maintain eligibility. Reports monitoring GPA, citizenship, federal and institutional eligibility are used to award and ensure reconciliation for each fund.
We follow the requirements of the research agreements.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION WAIVERS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' SUMMIT CHRISTIAN COLLEGE ACCOUNTS AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY AWARDED TO THOSE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR A PARTICULAR GRANT OR GRANTS. ALSO, THEY MUST MEET OUR SATISFACTORY PROGRESS POLICY TO CONTINUE RECEIVING THESE FUNDS, WHETHER IT IS FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OR FAULKNER UNIVERSITY FUNDS.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE COLLEGE FOR TUITION OF THE ENROLLEE.
ONCE TROCAIRE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTS, AND/OR STUDENT AID, AND THE STUDENT ACCEPTS THOSE FUNDS, THE COLLEGE DIRECTLY CREDITS THE STUDENTS TUITION BILL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Albany Medical College's Department of Financial Aid reviews applications for scholarships and distributes funds in accordance with scholarship restrictions. Funds are directly offset against tuition amounts owed.

Grants and scholarships are awarded to students based on specific criteria detailed in the various grant/scholarship agreements. Members of the financial aid office and various scholarship/award committees review records for all potential recipients to ensure that the scholarship/award is being awarded properly.

GRANTS CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND ELIGIBILITY EACH SEMESTER FOR EVERY STUDENT. WITHDRAWALS FROM CLASSES REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO HAVE A FORM SIGNED BY THE ACADEMIC OFFICE, THE BUSINESS OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED IS PRO-RATED BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ARE MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT THE UNIVERSITY MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROL OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. ADMINISTRATION OF GRANT ACTIVITIES IS COORDINATED BETWEEN THE ACADEMIC OFFICE OF RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROJECTS, THE UNIVERSITY ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THESE OFFICES ENSURE THAT APPROPRIATE CONTROLS ARE ESTABLISHED AND THAT GRANT REQUIREMENTS FOR DOCUMENTATION, TRACKING, EXPENDITURE OF FUNDS, AND REPORTING ARE MET.
ALL FINANCIAL AID THAT IS AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THE TUITION BILLING FOR THE STUDENT. ALL AID IS USED TO REDUCE THE TUITION PAYABLE.

GARDNER-WEBB UNIVERSITY PRACTICES A YEARLY REVIEW (AT THE END OF THE SPRING SEMESTER) TO MONITOR ALL STUDENTS AWARDED AN INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: 1) ENROLLMENT STATUS 2) HOUSING STATUS 3) GPA 4) MAINTAINING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS PROVIDED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES. ALL AWARDS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AND REVIEWED BY THE COLLEGE'S BUSINESS OFFICE.

EARTH University Foundation was formed to support the educational mission of the Escuela de Agricultura de La Region Tropical Humeda through generous gifts from the global community and other programs and initiatives. The Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) public charity headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. EARTH University is an international institution created out of a deep conviction that the environmental and social challenges confronting the planet can be resolved through education that promotes science, technology and entrepreneurship while focusing on essential human values, leadership and a commitment to social and environmental service. The University provides support to the Earth University Foundation to cover administrative expenses. The Foundation intends that most of the money it raises be directed to the University to support its educational mission. The University requires periodic reports from the Foundation on the expenses it incurs and the manner in which it is using monies provided by the University. Since the Foundation's primary exempt purpose is to support the University's mission, there is no concern that monies sent to the Foundation will be used other than for a purpose that furthers the University's mission.
THE FOUNDATION MONITORS ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS BY ASSESSING STUDENT RECORDS, FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AWARDS.

BAKER UNIVERSITY MONITORS ALL GRANTS WITH SPECIFIC INQUIRIES AND REVIEWS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS. ALL GRANTS ARE PLACED UNDER THE RESPONSBILITY OF ONE INDIVIDUAL WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION. THE BUSINESS OFFICE WILL THEN ASSIST IN PREPARING DOCUMENTS WHICH ARE TYPICALLY REQUIRED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are applied directly to the student's receivable account. If scholarships exceed tuition and other fees the credit balance is carried forward to the next semester. No monies are sent directly to students.
This is internally funded assistance financed by the earnings of our restricted endowment fund.

ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AS EITHER NEED-BASED OR MERIT-BASED AWARDS. TO AWARD OR ADMINISTER NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS FEDERAL GUIDELINES STARTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF EACH STUDENT FOR "NEED" BASED ON FAFSA & NEED-ACCESS REPORTS. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL. ONCE AWARDEES ARE CHOSEN, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CURRENT ENROLLMENT) IS VERIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO INITIAL DISBURSEMENT OF ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED AGAIN FOR THE JANUARY TERM BEFORE SECOND TERM DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE.

THESE GRANTS FUND THE HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENTER'S RESPECTIVE PORTION OF THE 2013 EQUITY LOSS IN RELATION TO THE 8 EAST 102ND STREET MANAGER, LLC (EIN #45-2827030) PARTNERSHIP IN WHICH THE MOUNT SINAI HOSPITAL, THE MOUNT SINAI MEDICAL CENTER, AND ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI ARE MEMBERS.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED WITHIN THE GUIDELINES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. WILLIAM CAREY UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS DEPARTMENTS MONITOR THE PROGRAMS TO ASSURE THAT THEY FOLLOW FEDERAL GUIDELINES. THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS PERFORM AN AUDIT ON ALL FEDERAL PROGRAMS ANNUALLY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE PLACED DIRECTLY INTO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITH THE COLLEGE. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE USED TO PAY THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES OF THE COLLEGE.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON EITHER THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING, ACADEMIC MERIT, OR TALENT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS SCHOLARSHIP FUND AVAILABILITY, MAKES SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS, AND MAINTAINS AN ON-GOING AWARENESS OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

Use of grant funding must comply with the institution's purchasing policy and Federal guidelines. Primary Investigators are ultimately responsible for the use of those funds under the review of the Contract and Grants Accounting Manager that monitors their compliance. In addition, the College is subject to an A133 annual audit ensuring an outside opinion of the institutions policies and procedures.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN FOURTEEN DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE GRANTS (SCHOLARSHIPS) MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION AND FEES PAID BY THE STUDENT TO THE SCHOOL. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT SENT TO OUTSIDE ENTITIES.

Grantee submits annual financial reports. Each report includes spending of GtCNN funds by line item, a budget variance report, revenues received from other sources, and total program expenditures. At the end of the grant period (3-4 years) the grantee submits a final report. Reports are reviewed by GtCNN staff and inquiries are made at the time for any questioned items.

AFTER AN APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY THE STUDENT, FINANCIAL AID EVALUATES IT FOR NEED AND BASED ON THEIR ENROLLED COURSES, AND THIS IS RE-EVALUATED EACH YEAR AS NEED AND ENROLLMENT INDICATE. THE UNIVERSITY DOES MONITOR THE USE OF THE STUDENT AID AND IT IS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNT IN THE UNIVERSITY'S SIS (STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM).
THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL WHICH OUTLINES THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY ON AWARDING FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE THAT IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY TO STUDENTS IS DESIGNATED FOR TUITION, FEES, BOOKS, AND OTHER DIRECT EDUCATIONAL COSTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS AND CONTROLS DISBURSEMENT OF ALL ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE INSTITUTION TRACKS THIS INFORMATION BY SOURCE IN ITS ENTERPRISE RESOURCE PLANNING SYSTEM.

MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, REGARDLESS OF FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM, ESSAYS, RECOMMENDATIONS, AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES) TO APPLY FOR A MERIT SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COMMITTEE. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS. NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED SOLELY ON FAMILY FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM AND FEDERAL TAX INFORMATION) TO APPLY FOR A NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COLLEGE REPRESENTATIVE AND A STANDARD FINANCIAL AID CALCULATOR IS USED. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. CREDITS AGAINST ROOM AND BOARD CHARGES ARE ISSUED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED TO RESIDENT ASSISTANT POSITIONS. CREDITS ARE GIVEN IN STANDARD AMOUNTS. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF CREDITS GIVEN.
INQUIRY AND REVIEW OF CLIENT DOCUMENTATION.

THE UNIVERSITY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF EACH STUDENT BUDGET AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROFESSIONAL PROMISE, LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SPECIFIC GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES AVAILABLE FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN WHICH ELIGIBLE AWARD AMOUNTS ARE ALSO BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN THE FAFSA. WORK STUDY EXPENDED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS ARE TRACKED AND REVIEWED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO ASSISTED BY PROVIDING FUNDS FOR GENERAL OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO THE HEALTH EDUCATION AND RESIDENCY TRAINING NETWORK, A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION OF MEMBER MEDICAL AND EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR MEDICAL STUDENTS,INTERNS AND RESIDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Student aid is based on academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. The College evaluates student eligibility at the end of each semester for the following term and also before disbursement of financial aid.
GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE PROCESSED AND MONITORED BY THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE. ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND ENTITLEMENT AWARDS ARE COORDINATED AND MONITORED BY THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE. ALL FINANCIAL AID OFFERS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ADMINISTRATIVELY APPOINTED STUDENT FINANCE COMMITTEE. WORK STUDY POSITIONS ARE OFFERED AND REGULATED BY THE PERSONNEL OFFICER IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FACULTY MEMBER OR ADMINISTRATIVE SUPERVISOR.

Students submit the Federal FAFSA and this form is reviewed to award scholarships and other tuition discounts. Students also receive awards based on service (athletics) as well as academic or extracurricular achievements. The Director of Financial Aid and the VP of Enrollment maintain appropriate records to substantiate any financial assistance students receive. That information is subject to annual audit under OMB A-133 for any federal money the school receives. Awards are credited to student accounts. Accounts are reconciled throughout the year.

AUGSBURG COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.
SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT WITH THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND OTHER SIMILAR COSTS. NO CASH IS AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS.
Policy guides, accounting software, and annual audit.

ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY IN ORDER TO ENSURE GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED APPROPRIATELY BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD CRITERIA.
The Organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the students account directly. This system ensures that the funds are used appropriately.
All expenditures are reviewed by the Executive Director before advancement.
STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS USING FEDERAL FAFSA APPLICATIONS. SPECIFIC CRITERIA ARE APPLIED TO CONFIRM ELIGIBILITY AND TO ASSURE FAIRNESS TO ALL APPLICANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES TYPICALLY FOLLOWED BY COLLEGES IN THE UNITED STATES USING FAFSA AND THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION CRITERIA. FEDERAL GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO THE SINGLE AUDIT ACT OF THE UNITED STATES.

LINCOLN MEDICAL EDUCATION PARTNERSHIP PROVIDES GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS LOCATED IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA. GRANTS ARE AWARDED AS PER STUDY PROTOCOLS (FOR CANCER RESEARCH) OR ON A LIMITED BASIS TO PARTICIPANTS IN STEPPING STONES FOR FAMILIES PROGRAM.

TABOR COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

INITIAL MERIT AID FOR NEW FIRST YEAR AND TRANSFER FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS IS DETERMINED BY VARIABLES SUCH AS ACT TEST SCORES, HIGH SCHOOL GPA, TOP % OF HIGH SCHOOL CLASS, AND TRANSFER GPA. THIS INFORMATION IS DATA ENTERED INTO THE SOFTWARE AND THEN A FACTOR IS DETERMINED. THAT FACTOR DETERMINES THE MERIT AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. RULES IN THE SOFTWARE ALERT MANUAL AWARD ENTRY ERROR. RENEWAL OF MERIT AID IS DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF AWARDING THE AID FOR THE NEXT YEAR BY REVIEWING GRAND VIEW GPA AND SEMESTERS OF RECEIVED AID. AS A FOLLOW-UP FOR THOSE AWARDED PRIOR TO THE SPRING GRADES, A REPORT IS REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF THE GPA CRITERIA WAS MET AT THE END OF THE TERM. GRAND VIEW IS A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS AND OFFERS ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS IN BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, BOWLING, CROSS COUNTRY, FOOTBALL, GOLF, SOCCER, TRACK AND FIELD, WRESTLING, VOLLEYBALL AND TENNIS FOR MEN, AND BASKETBALL, BOWLING, COMPETITIVE DANCE, CROSS COUNTRY, GOLF, SOCCER, SOFTBALL, TRACK AND FIELD, VOLLEYBALL AND TENNIS FOR WOMEN. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ABILITY AS EVALUATED BY THE COACHES. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, INTERVIEW WITH AND BE RECOMMENDED BY THE COACH, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. COACHES ARE GIVEN A BUDGET FOR THE YEAR TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN PLAYERS. APPEALS FOR ADDITIONAL DOLLARS ARE MONITORED BY THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR, ATHLETIC DIRECTOR, FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ATHLETIC SUCCESS COORDINATOR AND THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR. COMMUNICATION OF STUDENT AWARDS IS DONE VIA EMAIL BETWEEN THE ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR AND FINANCIAL AID. ART, MUSIC & THEATER AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE TALENT. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, MEET WITH THE CHAIR OF THE DEPARTMENT, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO GRAND VIEW. RENEWAL IS BASED ON GPA OR GOOD STANDING. EACH DEPARTMENT HAS A BUDGET TO USE TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN STUDENTS. COMMUNICATIONS FOR INITIAL AWARDS ARE GIVEN TO THE ADMISSIONS DIRECTOR AND FORWARDED TO THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. ROSTERS OF THOSE TO RENEW ARE SENT TO THE CHAIR TO EVALUATE BASED ON GPA, ACADEMIC STANDING AND PARTICIPATION. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY FINANCIAL AID. AN ALERT WILL BE GIVEN IF AN AWARD IS ENTERED OVER THE BUDGETED AMOUNT. ANNUAL AND ENDOWED AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON DONOR QUALIFICATIONS. ADVANCEMENT, BUSINESS OFFICE, AND FINANCIAL AID SIGN OFF AND RECEIVE COPIES OF NEW FUNDS CREATED. THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ADVANCEMENT TO DETERMINE WHICH FUNDS AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED IN A GIVEN YEAR IN JANUARY. NOTIFICATIONS GO TO DEPARTMENTS OF FACULTY PICKS. FINANCIAL AID PICKS ARE DETERMINED BY RUNNING A REPORT TO GET STUDENTS WHO MEET DONOR REQUIREMENTS. MOST OF THESE AWARDS REQUIRE A SCHOLARSHIP ACCEPTANCE AND THANK YOU TO THE DONOR. DISBURSEMENT RULES WILL NOT ALLOW THE FUND TO BE DISBURSED UNTIL THIS DOCUMENTATION IS RECEIVED. PACKAGING PROCEDURES ARE DEVELOPED EACH YEAR AND UTILIZED TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. IN THIS WAY, AID IS GIVEN IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.

To ensure our grants and scholarships are used for proper purposes the Financial Aid Office performs regular maintenance and reconciliation with our Bursar's Office monitoring that all funds awarded to a particular student are being properly credited to their student account. Any changes or adjustments to original awards that affect grant and scholarship funding are documented, saved and then copied to our Bursar's Office. These processes are completed utilizing an automated software system which allows us to generate reports at anytime for monitoring and reconciliation purposes. Additionally, we have a yearly audit performed by an outside accounting firm guaranteeing we are staying in compliance with all federal, state, and institutional policies and procedures as well as assuring funding is being used as intended.
All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH STUDENT'S NEEDS AND THE AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE STUDENT'S CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE THE ASSISTANCE.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT ATTEND ONE OF THE COMPANY'S COLLEGES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS SUBMITTED BY STUDENTS OR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS, COMPARES THE APPLICATIONS WITH THE WRITTEN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND DETERMINES IF THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE AND THEN APPROVES OR REJECTS AN APPLICATION. A WRITTEN RECORD OF THE APPROVALS AND THE AMOUNTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS MAINTAINED. THE ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS ARE THEN NOTIFIED OF THE AMOUNT OF ANY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED AND A PRO RATA PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM THE COLLEGE, THE UNUSED PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CANCELLED.

SUBSEQUENT TO ADMISSION, ACTON MAY OFFER STUDENTS PARTICIPATION IN THE ACTON FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM ("PROGRAM") ONCE ALL OTHER FINANCIAL AVENUES HAVE BEEN EXHAUSTED, AND OCCASIONALLY, OFFER STUDENTS A FELLOWSHIP BASED ON MERIT.
This is part of the rental agreement for the Wellness Center
The Grantee of each approved grant is required to provide a mid-year report, as well as a year-end report, on the distributions and usage of grant funds.

AN INDEPENDENT SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL APPLICANTS AND AWARDS THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS. ALL APPLICATIONS FOR FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS WHO ARE QUALIFIED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE REVIEWED BY THE INDEPENDENT SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE FOR RECOMMENDATION, FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS ARE THEN REFERRED TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR AWARDING.

HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN VARIOUS LOCAL SPONSORSHIPS TO ORGANIZATIONS ANNUALLY BASED ON OUR ABILITY AND CURRENT ECONOMIC SITUATION. BECAUSE THE SPONSORSHIPS ARE FOR GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT, NO MONITORING IS REQUIRED. HODGES UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. VIRTUALLY ALL FUNDS RECEIVED ARE IMMEDIATELY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS FOR PAYMENT OF TUITION, FEES AND BOOKS. EXCESS FUNDS ARE DELIVERED TO STUDENTS ACCORDING TO PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.

LIPSCOMB UNIVERSITY HAS AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL AID AWARDING PROCESS (CALLED THE OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDIT). IN ADDITION, FINANCIAL AID COUNSELORS ATTEND CONFERENCES AND TRAINING SESSIONS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDING POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION ASSISTANCE ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNTS. NO CASH IS GIVEN TO STUDENTS.

ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANT AID IS DETERMINED BY A FORMAL APPLICATION PROCESS (FAFSA) AND GUIDED BY FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. COLLEGE PERSONNEL CONFIRM EACH RECIPIENT'S PAST AND CURRENT AID VIA FEDERAL (NSLDS) AND STATE PROVIDED SOFTWARE. COMPLIANCE AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM ARE CONDUCTED ANNUALLY.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SPECIFIC DEPARTMENT RELATED TO STUDENT FINANCIAL AID THAT TRACKS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANT FUNDS DISBURSED TO STUDENTS.

STUDENTS AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE ENROLLED, AND FOR CONTINUED FUNDING, MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THE SEMESTER PROJECT; SOME SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRES MANUSCRIPT SUBMISSION, REVIEW AND SELECTION BY FACULTY.

The College follows state and federal guidelines in providing financial aid to students as well as internal criteria based upon academic progress, criteria established by particular scholarships, and/or financial need. The federal FAFSA form is used in this process as well.

THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORS THE COURAGEOUS JOURNEY PROGRAM ESTABLISHED BY MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS WITH AN ANNUAL FIXED CONTRIBUTION AMOUNT TO BE USED EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE PROMOTION OF THE PROGRAM. THE ORGANIZATION IS CLOSELY INVOLVED WITH THE EXECUTION OF THE PROGRAM.

USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE COLLEGE HAS IN PLACE ASSURANCES/SAFEGUARDS THAT INCLUDE GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, AND ADDITIONAL FISCAL PROCEDURES FOR THE SUBMISSION AND APPROVAL OF INVOICES FOR THE PROPER USE OF GRANT FUNDS. FOR EXPENDITURES THAT PROVIDE SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS (IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PAY FOR TUITION, SUPPLIES AND FEES), THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE KEEPS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ON EACH INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT THAT INCLUDES DATA ON ELIGIBILITY, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND AMOUNT OF FUNDS AWARDED/DISBURSED. FOR EXPENDITURES IN SUPPORT OF PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES PROGRAM MANAGERS MUST REVIEW EXPENDITURE REQUESTS TO ENSURE THAT EACH IS AN APPROPRIATE EXPENDITURE FOR APPROVED ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED BUDGET FOR THE GRANT.
THE COLLEGE OF FELLOWS REQUIRES TWO REPORTS EACH YEAR FROM THE RECIPIENTS. THOSE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

OTHER ASSISTANCE AS OTHER UNIVERSITY SUPPORT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY BY DISBURSING DONATED FUNDS TO VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY. THESE DISBURSEMENTS REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION STATING THE REASON FOR THE DISBURSEMENT AND ARE APPROVED BY A SUPERVISOR KNOWLEDGABLE ABOUT THE ACTIVITY REQUESTING THE FUNDING.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY IS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS USING FEDERALLY APPROVED FINANCIAL NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA.
ALL FUNDS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS ARE DONE SO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on specific criteria established by student financial services in regards to eligibility, student selection and requirements of the scholarship. Each scholarship recipient will be monitored by the University to confirm that they have satisfied all scholarship requirements. The actual scholarships are credited to the students tuition bills. No scholarships are awarded directly to the student.
THE TRUST DOCUMENT SPECIFIES THAT CERTAIN FUNDS ARE TO BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE OTHER TRUSTS AND TO THE COLLEGE.

All scholarships are monitored by the Financial Aid Office with attention given to the criteria set forth for each award as well as the student's enrollment status. The scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts.
THE GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO THE PORTLAND STATE UNIVERSITY FOUNDATION AND THEY DETERMINE THE ELIGIBILITY OF THE STUDENTS. THEY PROVIDE US WITH A LIST OF STUDENTS THAT HAVE WON THE SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS ANY CHANGES IN THE STATUS OF FINANCIAL AWARD RECIPIENTS THAT WOULD RESULT IN A CORRESPONDING CHANGE IN THE AMOUNT OF AID AWARDED. ANY SUCH CHANGES ARE AUTOMATICALLY DETECTED AND REPORTED BY A SERIES OF SPECIAL REPORTS THAT ARE RUN ON A REGULAR BASIS. MOREOVER, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS ENSURES THAT THE CHARGES TO WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE APPLIED ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INTENDED USE OF THE AWARDS.

The federal aid office of the University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State, and Institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the Institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.
